On 12/3/12 3:19 AM, Coram, Roger wrote:
> Is there a mechanism, whether via Heritrix or Spring, to dump the
> current config. values?
>
> Essentially we�d like to have a record of all the �tweaks� made during
> the crawl. The web interface does offer the ability to browse all the
> beans and their corresponding values, I was just wondering whether this
> could be automated and/or output en masse.

Unfortunately, no such facility yet exists.

The idea has come up in other contexts, see:

"Some projects want completely-explicit (no defaults) CXML configuration"
https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1897

There are some ideas in that issue around how Spring options (or new 
annotations) could be used to help enforce a 'maximally explicit' 
original configuration, but no work done yet on that.

Something based on those same build/spec options might be usable to take 
a raw spec and use it as a template, to discover all 'interesting' and 
'original' configuration values, and then interrogate a running 
configuration for its current/different values.

It'd require some careful new coding and might be prone to 
miss/misinterpret subtle changes outside the simple beans property 
model. (Some tricky areas would include: values from scripts, from other 
volatile configuration files, and any values/objects normally 
unmentioned in the CXML.)

- Gordon
